Notes-From-Ian.label: again, prefer to keep as site, as it is more specific and takes up less space, it is more economic and more specific to keep this label for the site rather than the region. If we have the site, we can locate the region; if we have the region, we cannot locate the site. And site labels take up less space. Also, if we were to make it a regional label, would it not be preferable to use the classical form Zabdicene (like Adiabene) for this map?

Notes_from_working-data.label: This C5th monastery is on a hill to the south of Urfa now almost reached by suburbs. It is difficult to reach and marked on few maps – I have been unable to locate it in gazetteers. John Healey alerted me to its existence ahead of field work in Urfa.

Notes-4-Ian.label: ‘Zhenjiang’ and ‘Yangzhou’: The two cities are actually located on the north and south banks of the Yangtze. On the map as it stands now, the point for Yangzhou is placed on the river and it looks like Zhenjiang lies further north, away for the river. Could the points be moved further south so that they sandwich the line for the river?
